IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO INVEST IN PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MAKE LIFE BETTER FOR MICHIGAN MASONS, THEIR FAMILIES, AND THEIR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO INVEST IN PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MAKE LIFE BETTER FOR MICHIGAN MASONS, THEIR FAMILIES, AND THEIR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO MASONIC AFFILIATED RESIDENTS LIVING AT MICHIGAN MASONIC HOME. APPROXIMATELY 400 MASONIC AFFILIATED RESIDENTS BENEFIT FROM THE CHARITY OF THE FOUNDATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MAINTAIN MASONIC LIBRARY AND MUSEUM FOR PUBLIC USE, INFORMATIONAL REQUESTS, AND RESEARCH BY SCHOLARS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MATCHING SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM INITIATED THRU LOCAL MASONIC LODGES WITH MATCHING FUNDS UP TO 1,500 PER RECIPIENT. TOTAL INDIVIDUALS AWARDED COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS IN FY18 WAS 162.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: Financial derivatives and other financial products

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: INTER'L ORDER OF THE RAINBOW MI GRAND ASSEMBLY
OAKLAND COUNTY YOUTH ASSISTANCE COORDINATING COUNCIL INC

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Program Service Expenses 36,530, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 MICHIGAN CHILD ID PROGRAM PROVIDES PARENTS GUARDIANS WITH A CHILD ID KIT THAT CONTAINS ALL THE VITAL INFORMATION NECESSARY TO EXPEDITE LAW ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS TO LOCATE A MISSING CHILD. THE PROGRAM ALSO HELPS TO EDUCATE FAMILIES ABOUT ABDUCTION PREVENTION AND SAFETY. TOTAL EVENTS HELD FOR FY18 WAS 123 WITH 5,940 CHILDREN BEING IDD.

Program Service Expenses 25,943, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 STUDENT ASSISTANCE TRAINING PROGRAM TO TEACH EDUCATORS AND SCHOOL COUNCELORS HOW TO IDENTIFY STUDENTS WHO ARE AT RISK OF DRUG AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE. 2 PROGRAMS WERE CONDUCTED DURING FY18 WITH 996 ATTENDEES.

Program Service Expenses 108,331, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 MATCHING COMMUNITY CHARITY PROGRAM INITIATED THRU LOCAL MASONIC LODGES WITH MATCHING FUNDS OF UP TO 1,500 PER REQUEST. TOTAL GRANTS AWARDED IN FY18 WAS 258.
Program Service Expenses 209,582, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 OVERHEAD PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES FOR THE ABOVE PROGRAMS.

Program Service Expenses 53,306, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 ALMONERS FUND PROGRAM WAS ESTABLISHED TO ASSIST MASTER MASONS, THEIR WIDOWS, AND ORPHANS WITH IMMEDIATE CATASTROPHIC OR EMERGENCY NEEDS, UP TO 1,000. DURING FY18, 53 RECIPIENTS WERE HELPED.
Program Service Expenses 38,861, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 BOARD COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROGRAM AWARDED 11 GRANTS DURING FY2018.

Program Service Expenses 871,589, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 B.E.S.T. COMMUNITY GRANT PROGRAM IS AWARDING GRANTS TO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS SEFVING THE GREAT RESIDENTS OF MICHIGAN TO HELP BUILD, EMPOWER, STRENGTHEN AND TRANSFORM OUR MICHIGAN COMMUNITIES.

Program Service Expenses 18,141, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 WIDOWS AND ORPHANS PROGRAM IMPACTS AFFILIATED WIDOWS THROUGH QUARTERLY NEWSLETTERS, BIRTHDAY AND CHRISTMAS GREETINGS, AND FREE ENROLLMENT IN THE LIVE BETTER AT HOME PROGRAM ADMINISTERED BY MICHIGAN MASONIC HOME. QUALIFYING ORPHANS, IF UNDER 18 YEARS OLD, CAN BE PROVIDED FINANCIAL ASSITANCE AND/OR IF UNDER 21 YEARS OF AGE, MAY QUALIFY FOR EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE.
Program Service Expenses 92,074, Grants and allocations 0, Revenue 0 MASONIC YOUTH PROGRAMS
